  table td p { margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; }
</style>

Provides an Elastic Beanstalk Application Resource. Elastic Beanstalk allows
you to deploy and manage applications in the AWS cloud without worrying about
the infrastructure that runs those applications.

This resource creates an application that has one configuration template named
`default`, and no application versions

> This content is derived from https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-aws/blob/master/website/docs/r/elastic_beanstalk_application.html.markdown.

## Support Types

#### ApplicationAppversionLifecycle

<table class="ml-6">
    <thead>
        <tr>
            <th>Argument</th>
            <th>Type</th>
            <th>Description</th>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <td class="align-top">delete<wbr>Source<wbr>From<wbr>S3</td>
            <td class="align-top"><code>boolean</code></td>
            <td class="align-top">{{% md %}}
(Optional) Set to `true` to delete a version's source bundle from S3 when the application version is deleted.

{{% /md %}}</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="align-top">max<wbr>Age<wbr>In<wbr>Days</td>
            <td class="align-top"><code>number</code></td>
            <td class="align-top">{{% md %}}
(Optional) The number of days to retain an application version.

{{% /md %}}</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="align-top">max<wbr>Count</td>
            <td class="align-top"><code>number</code></td>
            <td class="align-top">{{% md %}}
(Optional) The maximum number of application versions to retain.

{{% /md %}}</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td class="align-top">service<wbr>Role</td>
            <td class="align-top"><code>string</code></td>
            <td class="align-top">{{% md %}}
(Required) The ARN of an IAM service role under which the application version is deleted.  Elastic Beanstalk must have permission to assume this role.

{{% /md %}}</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
